title: Manchester United fear heavy loss to Liverpool could lead to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s sacking
text:
Solskjaer still has the backing of club bosses (Picture: Getty)

Figures inside Manchester United fear a heavy defeat at the hands of Liverpool could lead to the firing of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, reports say.

Solskjaer is under increasing pressure to deliver performances at United after his side succumbed to their third Premier League defeat of the season to Newcastle last weekend.

There is now a two-week international break, but United have the daunting task of welcoming league leaders Liverpool to Old Trafford when club action resumes.

Liverpool are unbeaten in the league and are yet to drop a single point, and have already had impressive victories over Arsenal and Chelsea.

The BBC claim there are concerns within United that ‘external pressure’ could prompt the club to sack Solskjaer should Liverpool run riot at Old Trafford.

Advertisement

Jamie Redknapp is among those who have questioned whether Solskjaer is up to the job, while Gary Neville went on another explosive rant following United’s defeat to Newcastle.

Neville hit out at the current squad and was particularly incensed by the leadership demonstrated by executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward.

United insiders fear a heavy loss against Liverpool will serve as confirmation for those who feel Solskjaer is not experienced enough to steer the Red Devils back to the top.

Solskjaer has just two wins from his last 13 league games in charge and United have made their worst start to a league season in 30 years.

Liverpool come to Old Trafford on 10 October (Picture: Getty)

United, however, have a host of first-team stars currently sidelined with injury and are due to welcome back the likes of Paul Pogba, Anthony Martial, Luke Shaw, Jesse Lingard, Victor Lindelof and Aaron Wan-Bissaka after the international break.

There is a belief that once the squad is fully fit again, Solskjaer will be able to steady the ship.
